biography_text: MALONEY, Sean Patrick, a Representative from New York; born in Sherbrooke, Quebec, Canada, July 30, 1966; graduated from Hanover High School, Hanover, N.H., 1984; attended Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., 1986; B.A., University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va., 1988; J.D., University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va., 1992; campaign aide; lawyer, private practice; businessman; staff secretary to President William J. Clinton, 1997-2000; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for New York attorney general in 2006; first deputy secretary to New York Governor Eliot Spitzer, 2007-2008; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Thirteenth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2013-present).
